properties.name: camel.component.azure-functions.app-service-manager
properties.description: An AppServiceManager instance for management operations. The option is a com.azure.resourcemanager.appservice.AppServiceManager type.

properties.name: camel.component.azure-functions.autowired-enabled
properties.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

properties.name: camel.component.azure-functions.client-id
properties.description: Azure AD Client ID for service principal authentication

properties.name: camel.component.azure-functions.client-secret
properties.description: Azure AD Client Secret for service principal authentication

properties.name: camel.component.azure-functions.configuration
properties.description: The component configuration. The option is a org.apache.camel.component.azure.functions.FunctionsConfiguration type.

properties.name: camel.component.azure-functions.connection-timeout
properties.description: Connection timeout in milliseconds for HTTP invocation

properties.name: camel.component.azure-functions.credential-type
properties.description: Determines the credential strategy to adopt

properties.name: camel.component.azure-functions.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable auto configuration of the azure-functions component. This is enabled by default.

properties.name: camel.component.azure-functions.function-key
properties.description: The function key for direct HTTP invocation

properties.name: camel.component.azure-functions.host-key
properties.description: The host key for the function app (used if function key is not provided)

properties.name: camel.component.azure-functions.http-method
properties.description: HTTP method for function invocation (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, etc.)

properties.name: camel.component.azure-functions.lazy-start-producer
properties.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

properties.name: camel.component.azure-functions.location
properties.description: Azure region for creating function app (e.g., eastus, westeurope)

properties.name: camel.component.azure-functions.operation
properties.description: The operation to be performed

properties.name: camel.component.azure-functions.read-timeout
properties.description: Read timeout in milliseconds for HTTP invocation

properties.name: camel.component.azure-functions.resource-group
properties.description: The resource group name containing the function app (required for management operations)

properties.name: camel.component.azure-functions.runtime
properties.description: Runtime stack (java, node, python, dotnet)

properties.name: camel.component.azure-functions.runtime-version
properties.description: Runtime version

properties.name: camel.component.azure-functions.storage-account-connection-string
properties.description: Storage account connection string for function app

properties.name: camel.component.azure-functions.subscription-id
properties.description: The Azure subscription ID (required for management operations)

properties.name: camel.component.azure-functions.tenant-id
properties.description: Azure AD Tenant ID

properties.name: camel.component.azure-functions.token-credential
properties.description: A TokenCredential instance for Azure AD authentication. The option is a com.azure.core.credential.TokenCredential type.
